de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface ListDialogDecorator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dialog
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractListDialog, ListDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog

    public interface ListDialogDecorator
extends Dialog
    Defines the interface, a decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items, must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        getContext

    • Method Detail

      • getListView

        ListView getListView()
        Returns the list view, which is contained by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The list view, which is contained by the dialog, as an instance of the class ListView or null, if the dialog does not show any list items or has not been shown yet

      • getListAdapter

        ListAdapter getListAdapter()
        Returns the adapter of the list view, which is contained by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The adapter of the list view, which is contained by the dialog, as an instance of the type ListAdapter or null, if the dialog does not show any list items

      • getItemColor

        int getItemColor()
        Returns the color of the list items of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the list items of the dialog as an Integer value or -1, if no custom color has been set

      • setItemColor

        void setItemColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the list items of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • getItemControlColor

        int getItemControlColor()
        Returns the control color of the list items of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the list items of the dialog as an Integer value or -1, if no custom color has been set

      • setItemControlColor

        void setItemControlColor(int color)
        Sets the control color of the list items of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The control color, which should be set, as an Integer value or -1, if no list items are shown or if the dialog has not been shown yet

      • setItems

        void setItems(@NonNull
              java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
              @Nullable
              DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the items, which should be shown by the dialog.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setItems

        void setItems(@ArrayRes
              int resourceId,
              @Nullable
              DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the items, which should be shown by the dialog.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setAdapter

        void setAdapter(@NonNull
                ListAdapter adapter,
                @Nullable
                DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the adapter, which provides the items, which should be shown by the dialog.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type ListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        void setSingleChoiceItems(@NonNull
                          java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                          int checkedItem,
                          @Nullable
                          DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        void setSingleChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                          int resourceId,
                          int checkedItem,
                          @Nullable
                          DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        void setSingleChoiceItems(@NonNull
                          ListAdapter adapter,
                          int checkedItem,
                          @Nullable
                          DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the adapter, which provides the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type ListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        void setMultiChoiceItems(@NonNull
                         java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                         @Nullable
                         boolean[] checkedItems,
                         @Nullable
                         DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        void setMultiChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                         int resourceId,
                         @Nullable
                         boolean[] checkedItems,
                         @Nullable
                         DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setOnItemSelectedListener

        void setOnItemSelectedListener(@Nullable
                               AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when an item, which is shown by the dialog is selected.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener or null, if no listener should be notified
